byline.contributor: Ben Shpigel contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By REBECCA R. RUIZ and JERÉ LONGMAN

abstract: International Paralympic Games, set to start in Rio de Janeiro on Sept 7, face significant budget cuts due to low ticket sales and sponsorships; cuts will affect workers, transportation and venues, but not number of scheduled events.
lead_paragraph: The Paralympic Games, set to start Sept. 7, are in a precarious financial position, with budget cuts affecting the number of workers, transportation options and sports venues.
snippet: The Paralympic Games, set to start Sept. 7, are in a precarious financial position, with budget cuts affecting the number of workers, transportation options and sports venues....

headline.main: Brazil’s Economic Crisis Forces Cuts to Paralympics in Rio
headline.print_headline: Brazil’s Economic Woes Force Paralympic Cuts
